Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Inexperienced \In`ex*pe"ri*enced\, a. Not having experience; unskilled; naive. ``Inexperienced youth.'' --Cowper. [1913 Webster]

inexperienced adj 1: lacking practical experience or training [ant: {experienced}] 2: lacking basic knowledge; "how can someone that age be so ignorant?"; "inexperienced and new to the real world" [syn: {ignorant}] 3: lacking experience of life; "a callow youth of seventeen" [syn: {callow}, {naive}, {unsophisticated}]
